content:
TITLE: Defining Serverless AI Endpoint in Python with Beam
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a serverless endpoint function using the Beta9 framework. The code defines a function that squares an integer input and decorates it with @endpoint to specify resource requirements, including GPU type.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from beta9 import endpoint


# This will run on a remote A100-40 in your cluster
@endpoint(cpu=1, memory=128, gpu="A100-40")
def square(i: int):
    return i**2
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Parallel Function Execution with Beta9 SDK in Python
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to decorate and execute a function in parallel using Beta9's infrastructure. The example shows a square function running with specified CPU and GPU resources, mapped across multiple inputs. Each function invocation runs in an isolated runc container.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/sdk/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from beta9 import function

@function(
    cpu=0.25,
    gpu="L4",
)
def square(i: int):
    return i**2

def main():
    numbers = list(range(10))
    squared = []

    for result in square.map(numbers):
        squared.append(result)

    print("numbers:", numbers)
    print("squared:", sorted(squared))

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sample Beta9 Application Using Remote Function Execution
DESCRIPTION: Python code demonstrating a sample Beta9 application. It defines a remote function for squaring numbers and uses it to process a list of integers in parallel.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/docs/zh/zh_cn/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
from beta9 import function


@function(cpu=8)
def square(i: int):
    return i**2


def main():
    numbers = list(range(10))
    squared = []

     # ä¸ºåˆ—è¡¨ä¸­çš„æ¯ä¸ªé¡¹ç›®è¿è¡Œè¿œç¨‹å®¹å™¨
    for result in square.map(numbers):
        squared.append(result)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running a Python Function on an On-Prem Worker Pool
DESCRIPTION: This Python example shows how to define a function that will run on a specific GPU type (H100) in your worker pool. The code uses Beam's function decorator to specify hardware requirements and remote execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/docs/opa/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from beam import function

@function(gpu="H100")
def handler():
    return {"message": "This is running on your worker pool!"}

if __name__ == "__main__":
    handler.remote()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deploying Functions with the Beta9 CLI
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the command to deploy a Python function to Beam and the resulting curl command for invoking the deployed endpoint. It illustrates the deployment process and authentication requirements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ beta9 deploy app.py:square --name inference
=> Building image
=> Using cached image
=> Deployed ðŸŽ‰

curl -X POST 'https://inference.beam.cloud/v1' \
-H 'Authorization: Bearer [YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN]' \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-d '{}'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Connecting Bare-Metal Servers to Beam Cluster
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to connect a GPU server to a Beam cluster using the CLI and an installation script. It shows the machine creation command and the resulting cURL command that needs to be run on the target machine.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ beta9 machine create --pool lambda-a100-40

=> Created machine with ID: '9541cbd2'. Use the following command to set up the node:

#!/bin/bash
sudo curl -L -o agent https://release.beam.cloud/agent/agent && \
sudo chmod +x agent && \
sudo ./agent --token "AUTH_TOKEN" \
  --machine-id "9541cbd2" \
  --tailscale-url "" \
  --tailscale-auth "AUTH_TOKEN" \
  --pool-name "lambda-a100-40" \
  --provider-name "lambda"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Managed Machines in Beam Cluster
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to view all machines in a Beam cluster using the CLI. It displays information about each connected server including CPU, memory, GPU type, status, and pool assignment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ beta9 machine list

| ID       | CPU     | Memory     | GPU     | Status     | Pool        |
|----------|---------|------------|---------|------------|-------------|
| edc9c2d2 | 30,000m | 222.16 GiB | A10G    | registered | lambda-a10g |
| d87ad026 | 30,000m | 216.25 GiB | A100-40 | registered | gcp-a100-40 |

```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Machine and Adding to a Worker Pool
DESCRIPTION: This command creates a new machine entry in Beam and returns the necessary setup command to configure the agent on your physical hardware. The output includes tokens for authentication and network setup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/docs/opa/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ beam machine create --pool my-h100-pool

=> Created machine with ID: 'c11d3030'. Use the following command to setup the node:
# -- Agent setup
sudo curl -L -o agent https://release.beam.cloud/agent/agent && \
sudo chmod +x agent && \
sudo ./agent --token "MY_TOKEN" \
    --machine-id "c11d3030" \
    --tailscale-url "" \
    --tailscale-auth "tskey-auth" \
    --pool-name "my-h100-pool" \
    --provider-name "generic"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Worker Pool in Beam
DESCRIPTION: This command creates a new worker pool with specified GPU type and count. The pool is a logical grouping of workers with similar attributes and is the first step in setting up on-premise resources.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/docs/opa/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
beam pool create --name my-h100-pool --gpu-type A100 --default-gpu-count 1
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Entity-Relationship Diagram for Beam Cloud Beta9 using Mermaid
DESCRIPTION: This Mermaid code defines an entity-relationship diagram for the Beam Cloud Beta9 project. It outlines seven main entities (WORKSPACE, TOKEN, VOLUME, DEPLOYMENT, TASK, STUB, and OBJECT) with their attributes, primary keys, foreign keys, and relationships. The diagram helps visualize the database structure and connections between different components of the system.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/docs/datamodels/backend.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: mermaid
CODE:
```
erDiagram

    WORKSPACE {
        varchar name
        uint id PK
        varchar external_id
        datetime created_at
        datetime updated_at
    }

    TOKEN {
        uint id PK
        varchar external_id
        varchar key
        datetime created_at
        datetime updated_at
        bool active
        bool resuable
        uint workspace_id FK
    }

    VOLUME {
        uint id PK
        varchar external_id
        varchar name
        datetime created_at
        uint workspace_id FK
    }

    DEPLOYMENT {
        uint id PK
        varchar external_id
        uint version
        enum status
        datetime created_at
        datetime updated_at
        uint stub_id FK
        uint workspace_id FK
    }

    TASK {
        uint id PK
        varchar external_id
        datetime created_at
        datetime started_at
        bool ended_at
        uint stub_id FK
        uint workspace_id FK
    }

    STUB {
        uint id PK
        varchar external_id
        varchar name
        enum type
        JSON config
        uint object_id FK
        uint workspace_id FK
        datetime created_at
        datetime updated_at
    }

    OBJECT {
        uint id PK
        varchar external_id
        varchar hash
        int64 size
        datetime created_at
        uint workspace_id FK
    }

    WORKSPACE ||--o{ TOKEN : " "
    WORKSPACE ||--o{ VOLUME : " "
    WORKSPACE ||--o{ DEPLOYMENT : " "
    WORKSPACE ||--o{ TASK : " "
    WORKSPACE ||--o{ OBJECT : " "
    OBJECT ||--|| STUB : " "
    TASK ||--|| STUB : " "
    DEPLOYMENT ||--|| STUB : " "
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Available Machines in Beam
DESCRIPTION: This command lists all machines registered in your Beam inventory, showing their hardware specifications, status, and which pool they belong to. This is useful for verifying that machines are properly connected.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/docs/opa/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ beam machine list

| ID       | CPU     | Memory     | GPU     | Status     | Pool         |
|----------|---------|------------|---------|------------|------------|
| edc9c2d2 | 30,000m | 222.16 GiB | H100    | registered | my-h100-pool |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Beta9 SDK with Make
DESCRIPTION: This bash command runs the setup-sdk make target to install and configure the Beta9 Python SDK. It sets up the necessary Python environment for working with the Beta9 platform.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
make setup-sdk
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Beta9 SDK
DESCRIPTION: Bash command to set up the Beta9 SDK using the 'setup-sdk' make target. This command installs the Poetry package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/docs/zh/zh_cn/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
make setup-sdk
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Beta9 Server with Make
DESCRIPTION: This is a simple bash command to set up the Beta9 server using the make utility. It runs the setup target which automates the installation process for local development with k3d.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
make setup
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Beta9 Server Environment
DESCRIPTION: Bash command to set up the Beta9 server environment using the 'setup' make target. This command may override some existing tools.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/docs/zh/zh_cn/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
make setup
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Beta9 Gateway Health Endpoint
DESCRIPTION: This shell command demonstrates how to verify that the local Beta9 gateway is functioning correctly by making a curl request to the health endpoint. It's used after DNS configuration to confirm the setup works.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl http://beta9-gateway.beta9.svc.cluster.local:1994/api/v1/health
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Markdown Documentation for Beta9 SDK
DESCRIPTION: Commands to generate markdown documentation for the Beta9 SDK. Two options are provided - one to simply generate the markdown and another to generate and copy the output to clipboard on macOS systems.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/sdk/bin/docgen.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
# Generates markdown
./bin/docgen.py

# Generates markdown and copies to your clipboard (on macOS)
./bin/docgen.py | pbcopy
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Local DNS Configuration for Beta9
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides shell commands to configure local DNS using dnsmasq for multipart uploads and range downloads. It sets up DNS resolution for the .cluster.local domain to point to the local machine.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
brew install dnsmasq
echo 'address=/cluster.local/127.0.0.1' >> /opt/homebrew/etc/dnsmasq.conf
sudo bash -c 'mkdir -p /etc/resolver'
sudo bash -c 'echo "nameserver 127.0.0.1" > /etc/resolver/cluster.local'
sudo brew services start dnsmasq
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing and Applying Terraform Configuration for Beta9 Deployment
DESCRIPTION: Commands to initialize the Terraform environment and apply the configuration to provision resources on Crusoe Cloud for Beta9. This creates the necessary infrastructure based on the defined configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/deploy/crusoe/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
terraform init
terraform apply
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deploying and Scaling Fly.io Application
DESCRIPTION: Imports secrets, deploys the application, and scales it to run one instance in the IAD region. This multi-step process configures the complete deployment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/deploy/fly-io/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cat .env | fly secrets import
fly deploy
fly scale count 1 --max-per-region=1 --region=iad
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Subdomain URLs in YAML
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration snippet shows how to enable host-based URLs in the Beta9 gateway. The configuration sets the invokeURLType to 'host' for the gateway component.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
gateway:
  invokeURLType: host
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Environment Secret Configuration for JuiceFS Gateway
DESCRIPTION: Creates a .env file containing necessary configuration secrets including Tailscale auth key, JuiceFS credentials, and MinIO root credentials. These environment variables are required for the gateway deployment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/deploy/fly-io/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cat <<'EOF' | tee > .env
TAILSCALE_AUTHKEY="my-tailscale-authkey"
JUICEFS_NAME="my-filesystem"
JUICEFS_REDIS_URI="rediss://username:password@hostname:6379/0"
JUICEFS_BUCKET="https://fly.storage.tigris.dev/my-bucket-name"
JUICEFS_ACCESS_KEY="my-access-key"
JUICEFS_SECRET_KEY="my-secret-key"
MINIO_ROOT_USER="my-username"
MINIO_ROOT_PASSWORD="my-password"
EOF
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Python Requirements List
DESCRIPTION: Specifies Python package dependencies with pinned versions for a cloud application. Includes web frameworks (FastAPI), ASGI servers (uvicorn, gunicorn), networking libraries, and utility packages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/pkg/abstractions/image/base_requirements.txt#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
fastapi==0.109.0
gunicorn==22.0.0
uvicorn==0.29.0
requests==2.32.2
packaging==21.3
MarkupSafe==2.0.0
websockets==11.0.3
pydantic==2.5.3
betterproto-beta9==2.0.0b7
grpcio==1.60.0
httpx==0.24.1
bson==0.5.10
psutil==5.9.6
cloudpickle==3.0.0
rich==13.7.0
watchdog==4.0.0
six==1.16.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with Poetry for Beta9 Documentation Generator
DESCRIPTION: Installs all dependencies, including development dependencies, using Poetry package management tool. This is a prerequisite step before generating the documentation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/sdk/bin/docgen.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
poetry install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Tailscale Environment File
DESCRIPTION: Instructions for creating and placing a .tailscale.env file containing Tailscale configuration environment variables. The file must be present in the directory before applying the configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/manifests/kustomize/components/tailscale/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# tailscale\n\nThis requires a secret .env file named `.tailscale.env`. This should contain environment variables used to configure tailscale.\n\nWrite the file to this directory before applying.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Monitoring Beta9 Setup via SSH Log Tailing
DESCRIPTION: Command to monitor the Beta9 setup process by tailing the user-data log file over SSH. This allows real-time visibility into the deployment and configuration process on the Crusoe Cloud instance.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/deploy/crusoe/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
ssh -i ~/.ssh/id_crusoecloud ubuntu@<instance-ip> 'tail -n+1 -f /var/log/user-data.log'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Launching Fly.io Application
DESCRIPTION: Initializes a new fly.io application with specified organization and name. This command modifies the fly.toml configuration file without deploying.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/deploy/fly-io/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
fly launch --org my-org --name my-deployment --no-deploy --copy-config --yes
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Required Environment File Reference
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the requirement for a .fluent-bit.env file containing configuration environment variables for Fluent Bit setup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/manifests/kustomize/components/monitoring/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# monitoring\n\nThis requires a secret .env file named `.fluent-bit.env`. This should contain environment variables used to configure fluent-bit.\n\nWrite the file to this directory before applying.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Destroying Fly.io Application
DESCRIPTION: Removes the deployed application from fly.io platform completely.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/deploy/fly-io/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
fly app destroy --yes my-deployment
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Terraform Variables File for Crusoe Cloud Deployment
DESCRIPTION: Defines the SSH key path in the terraform.tfvars file which is required for the Beta9 deployment on Crusoe Cloud. The SSH key is used for secure access to the deployed instance.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/deploy/crusoe/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: terraform
CODE:
```
ssh_key_path  = "~/.ssh/id_crusoecloud.pub"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying pathspec Package Dependency in Python
DESCRIPTION: This line specifies that the project requires the pathspec Python package with exact version 0.12.1. The pathspec library provides utilities for matching pathname patterns, often used for gitignore-style pattern matching.
SOURCE: https://github.com/beam-cloud/beta9/blob/main/sdk/vendors.txt#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
pathspec==0.12.1
```
